articles.title: France Recognizes Palestinian State at UN Summit Meeting
articles.summary: French President **Emmanuel Macron** formally recognized a **Palestinian state** during a UN summit on Monday, leading Western governments to support the **two-state solution**. The landmark decision has infuriated **Israel** while galvanizing international diplomatic efforts for Middle East peace negotiations.

articles.title: Nvidia Commits $100 Billion Investment to OpenAI Infrastructure
articles.summary: **Nvidia** will invest up to **$100 billion** in **OpenAI's** massive data center expansion plans. The artificial intelligence lab aims to deploy Nvidia systems requiring **10 gigawatts** of power, marking the largest AI infrastructure partnership announced to date between the companies.

articles.title: Heat Waves Killed Over 60,000 Europeans Last Summer
articles.summary: More than **60,000 Europeans** died from extreme heat during the **2024 summer**, according to a new peer-reviewed study. Temperatures exceeded **41¬∞C** in **Rome** and other major cities, highlighting the deadly impact of climate change across the continent.

articles.title: Trump Claims Tylenol and Vaccines Cause Autism Without Evidence
articles.summary: President **Donald Trump** controversially linked **Tylenol** (acetaminophen/paracetamol) and vaccines to **autism** despite no scientific evidence supporting these claims. Medical experts and health organizations immediately rejected the statements, warning about potential public health risks from spreading medical misinformation.

articles.title: Supreme Court Reviews Trump's Power to Fire Agency Leaders
articles.summary: The **Supreme Court** agreed Monday to hear an expedited appeal determining whether President **Trump** can legally fire board members of **independent federal agencies**. The case involves the **Federal Trade Commission** and could reshape executive power over regulatory bodies nationwide.

articles.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa Forces Hong Kong to Shut Down
articles.summary: **Hong Kong** closed schools and businesses as **Super Typhoon Ragasa** approached with devastating force. Residents rushed to stock up on necessities while authorities cancelled flights and warned of extreme danger from the powerful storm system threatening the region.

articles.title: Indian Tech Stocks Plunge After Trump's H-1B Fee Hike
articles.summary: Major **Indian IT companies** saw shares plummet Monday after President **Trump** imposed a **$100,000 fee** on **H-1B visa** applications. The dramatic increase from previous fees threatens operational costs for tech firms relying heavily on skilled foreign workers.

articles.title: Ransomware Attack Cripples Major European Airports Since Friday
articles.summary: A **ransomware cyberattack** has disrupted **Europe's busiest airports** since Friday, targeting automated check-in systems according to **EU** investigators. The hackers caused significant delays at major hubs including **Heathrow**, affecting thousands of travelers across the continent.

articles.title: Pfizer Acquires Weight Loss Drug Maker Metsera for Billions
articles.summary: **Pfizer** announced Monday it will acquire weight-loss drugmaker **Metsera** for up to **$7.3 billion**, including future payments. The pharmaceutical giant paid **$47.50** per share, a **43% premium**, as it races to compete in the booming obesity medication market.

articles.title: NASA Selects Ten New Astronauts for Moon and Mars Missions
articles.summary: **NASA** introduced **10 new astronaut candidates** Monday, selected from **8,000 applicants**, to join the space agency's corps. The group includes **six women** and **four men** who will train for upcoming lunar missions and the unprecedented crewed journey to **Mars**.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Global politics heats up at UN.

historicalEvents.description: Neptune discovered, first planet found through mathematical prediction
Sigmund Freud dies in London after fleeing Nazi Austria
Richard Nixon gives famous Checkers speech to save career
First public version of web browser Mozilla Firefox released
